DataElement.preferredName: Study Staff Drug Diary Verify Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the study staff fully verified and signed off on the pill diary.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Study Staff Pharmacologic Substance Subject Diary Verification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it._The employees of an organization; personnel who assist their superior in carrying out an assigned task._Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances._An instrument used either to capture a subject's condition or symptoms, or to monitor compliance during a clinical trial or disease treatment while away from the clinical site._Support or establish by evidence or proof.

Concepts.definition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
The employees of an organization; personnel who assist their superior in carrying out an assigned task.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.:An instrument used either to capture a subject's condition or symptoms, or to monitor compliance during a clinical trial or disease treatment while away from the clinical site.:Support or establish by evidence or proof.

Concepts.definition: Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.
An instrument used either to capture a subject's condition or symptoms, or to monitor compliance during a clinical trial or disease treatment while away from the clinical site.
Support or establish by evidence or proof.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
